info.name: ADAgentAI Full Suite
info.description: Comprehensive collection of all 9 Ad Networks (264+ endpoints) verified for 2026.

request.description: Lists the AdMob publisher account that was most recently signed in to from the AdMob UI. For more information, see https://support.google.com/admob/answer/10243672.
Gets information about the specified AdMob publisher account.
Generates an AdMob Mediation report based on the provided report specification. Returns result of a server-side streaming RPC. The result is returned in a sequence of responses.
Update the specified mediation group under the specified AdMob account. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
List mediation groups under the specified AdMob account. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
Create a mediation group under the specific AdMob account. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.

Create an A/B testing experiment for a specified AdMob account and a mediation group. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
Stop the mediation A/B experiment and choose a variant. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
Generates an AdMob Network report based on the provided report specification. Returns result of a server-side streaming RPC. The result is returned in a sequence of responses.

Batch create the ad unit mappings under the specific AdMob account. The maximum allowed batch size is 100. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
List the apps under the specified AdMob account.
Creates an app under the specified AdMob account. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
Creates an ad unit under the specified AdMob account. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
List the ad units under the specified AdMob account.
List ad unit mappings under the specified AdMob account and ad unit. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
Create an ad unit mapping under the specific AdMob account and ad unit. This method has limited access. If you see a 403 permission denied error, please reach out to your account manager for access.
List the adapters of the ad source.
Generates Campaign Report based on provided specifications.
API to retrieve a Network object.
API to retrieve all the networks the current user has access to.

API to retrieve a list of `Contact` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `Role` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `Site` objects.
Submits a list of `Site` objects for approval.
API to retrieve a list of `Team` objects.
API to retrieve a User object. To get the current user, the resource name `networks/{networkCode}/users/me` can be used.
API to retrieve a list of `AudienceSegment` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `EntitySignalsMapping` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `TaxonomyCategory` objects.
Gets the latest state of a long-running operation. Clients can use this method to poll the operation result at intervals as recommended by the API service.

API to batch allow AdReviewCenterAds. This method supports partial success. Some operations may succeed while others fail. Callers should check the failedRequests field in the response to determine which operations failed.

API to batch block AdReviewCenterAds. This method supports partial success. Some operations may succeed while others fail. Callers should check the failedRequests field in the response to determine which operations failed.

API to retrieve a list of `ContentLabel` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `PrivateAuctionDeal` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `PrivateAuction` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `ProgrammaticBuyer` objects.
API to retrieve an AdUnit object.
API to retrieve a list of AdUnit objects.

API to retrieve a list of `Application` objects.

API to retrieve a list of `Browser` objects.

API to retrieve an Order object.
API to retrieve a list of `Order` objects. Fields used for literal matching in filter string: * `order_id` * `display_name` * `external_order_id`
API to retrieve an `AdBreak` object. Query an ad break by its resource name or custom asset key. Check the resource's `breakState` field to determine its state.

API to retrieve a list of `AdBreak` objects. By default, when no `orderBy` query parameter is specified, ad breaks are ordered reverse chronologically. However, ad breaks with a 'breakState' of 'SCHEDULED' or 'DECISIONED' are prioritized and appear first.

API to create an `AdBreak` object. Informs DAI of an upcoming ad break for a live stream event, with an optional expected start time. DAI will begin decisioning ads for the break shortly before the expected start time, if provided. Each live stream event can only have one incomplete ad break at any given time. The next ad break can be scheduled after the previous ad break has started serving, indicated by its state being `COMPLETE`, or it has been deleted. This method cannot be used if the `LiveStreamEvent` has [prefetching ad breaks enabled](https://developers.google.com/ad-manager/api/reference/latest/LiveStreamEventService.LiveStreamEvent#prefetchenabled) or the event is not active. If a `LiveStreamEvent` is deactivated after creating an ad break and before the ad break is complete, the ad break is discarded. An ad break's state is complete when the following occurs: - Full service DAI: after a matching ad break shows in the `LiveStreamEvent` manifest only when the ad break has started decisioning. - Pod Serving: after the ad break is requested using the ad break ID or break sequence.
API to update an `AdBreak` object. Modify an ad break when its state is `SCHEDULED`.

API to delete an `AdBreak` object. Deletes and cancels an incomplete ad break, mitigating the need to wait for the current break to serve before recreating an ad break. You can delete an ad break that has not started serving or seen in manifests, indicated by its state being `SCHEDULED` or `DECISIONED`.
API to retrieve an `AdBreak` object. Query an ad break by its resource name or custom asset key. Check the resource's `breakState` field to determine its state.

API to retrieve a list of `AdBreak` objects. By default, when no `orderBy` query parameter is specified, ad breaks are ordered reverse chronologically. However, ad breaks with a 'breakState' of 'SCHEDULED' or 'DECISIONED' are prioritized and appear first.

API to create an `AdBreak` object. Informs DAI of an upcoming ad break for a live stream event, with an optional expected start time. DAI will begin decisioning ads for the break shortly before the expected start time, if provided. Each live stream event can only have one incomplete ad break at any given time. The next ad break can be scheduled after the previous ad break has started serving, indicated by its state being `COMPLETE`, or it has been deleted. This method cannot be used if the `LiveStreamEvent` has [prefetching ad breaks enabled](https://developers.google.com/ad-manager/api/reference/latest/LiveStreamEventService.LiveStreamEvent#prefetchenabled) or the event is not active. If a `LiveStreamEvent` is deactivated after creating an ad break and before the ad break is complete, the ad break is discarded. An ad break's state is complete when the following occurs: - Full service DAI: after a matching ad break shows in the `LiveStreamEvent` manifest only when the ad break has started decisioning. - Pod Serving: after the ad break is requested using the ad break ID or break sequence.
API to retrieve an `AdBreak` object. Query an ad break by its resource name or custom asset key. Check the resource's `breakState` field to determine its state.

API to retrieve a list of `AdBreak` objects. By default, when no `orderBy` query parameter is specified, ad breaks are ordered reverse chronologically. However, ad breaks with a 'breakState' of 'SCHEDULED' or 'DECISIONED' are prioritized and appear first.

API to create an `AdBreak` object. Informs DAI of an upcoming ad break for a live stream event, with an optional expected start time. DAI will begin decisioning ads for the break shortly before the expected start time, if provided. Each live stream event can only have one incomplete ad break at any given time. The next ad break can be scheduled after the previous ad break has started serving, indicated by its state being `COMPLETE`, or it has been deleted. This method cannot be used if the `LiveStreamEvent` has [prefetching ad breaks enabled](https://developers.google.com/ad-manager/api/reference/latest/LiveStreamEventService.LiveStreamEvent#prefetchenabled) or the event is not active. If a `LiveStreamEvent` is deactivated after creating an ad break and before the ad break is complete, the ad break is discarded. An ad break's state is complete when the following occurs: - Full service DAI: after a matching ad break shows in the `LiveStreamEvent` manifest only when the ad break has started decisioning. - Pod Serving: after the ad break is requested using the ad break ID or break sequence.
API to retrieve a list of `CmsMetadataKey` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `CmsMetadataValue` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `ContentBundle` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `Content` objects.
API to retrieve a list of `Report` objects.

Initiates the execution of an existing report asynchronously. Users can get the report by polling this operation using `OperationsService.GetOperation`. Poll every 5 seconds initially, with an exponential backoff. Once a report is complete, the operation will contain a `RunReportResponse` in its response field containing a report_result that can be passed to the `FetchReportResultRows` method to retrieve the report data.

Returns the result rows from a completed report. The caller must have previously called `RunReport` and waited for that operation to complete. The rows will be returned according to the order specified by the `sorts` member of the report definition.
Lists operations that match the specified filter in the request. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `UNIMPLEMENTED`.

Deletes a long-running operation. This method indicates that the client is no longer interested in the operation result. It does not cancel the operation. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`.

Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Clients can use Operations.GetOperation or other methods to check whether the cancellation succeeded or whether the operation completed despite cancellation. On successful cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with an Operation.error value with a google.rpc.Status.code of `1`, corresponding to `Code.CANCELLED`.
